result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were revoked, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Alexander P Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $300.00 fine/cost to be paid to COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander P Peterson

records.addlTxt: 12/24/15 deceased
Original in 15CF319
Count 1

CASES: 15CF319,14CF301, 15CF151.  Defendant Alexander P Peterson in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Defendant Alexander P Peterson in custody.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 10:22 am.  
15CF319-Count 1 AMENDED-REPEATER STRICKEN - guilty plea.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  Counts 2 & 3 dismissed.  
SENTENCING:  40 DAYS PCJ, subj to GT & WR, credit for 36 days - time served.  DNA sample.  $200 DNA surcharge.  PCR.  10:35 am adj.

14CF301-Motion to enter JOC.  CT enters judgment.  CT-prelim was not held in 14CF301.  ADA-offer to vacate JOC.  CT-14CF301-fel conviction is vacated.  Count 1 dismissed.  

SENTENCING: 15CF151-CT finds elig for CIP & substance abuse pgm.  W/H sentence, probation up to 2 yrs.  COMPAS & follow thru.  Follow thru w/ MH & txt recomm.  Take medications as prescribed.  Complete any CS that DOC recommends if not employed.  Participate/complete all appropiate recommendations.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  
Credit for 75 days previously served.  Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.  May petition for early discharge if probation feels appropriate.  PCR.  11:02 am adj.
#1 Bond
